meanings.definition: To make or become dull or boring.
meanings.sent1: The long lecture seemed to bromize the students.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive tasks can bromize even the most enthusiastic person.
meanings.sent3: The movie was so bromized that it put everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The gray walls bromized the entire room, sucking out any excitement.
meanings.sent5: The monotonous music bromized the atmosphere, making it hard to stay awake.

meanings.sent1: The lack of creativity in his writing bromized the story.
meanings.sent2: Her constant use of cliches bromized her speech.
meanings.sent3: The party was so bromized with old jokes that no one laughed.
meanings.sent4: The bland food bromized the whole dining experience.
meanings.sent5: The generic decorations bromized the event, making it forgettable.
